1:
"Often since my youth they have attacked me,"
\q let Israel say.
\q
2:
"Often since my youth they have attacked me,
\q yet they have not defeated me.
\q
3:
The plowers plowed on my back;
\q they made their furrows long.
5:
May they all be put to shame and turned back,
\q those who hate Zion.
6:
May they be like the grass on the housetops
\q that withers before it grows up,
\q
7:
that cannot fill the reaper's hand
\q or the chest of the one who binds sheaves.
\q
